attacks.name: Surprise
attacks.text: Look at a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent shuffles that card into his or her deck.

data.name: Galarian Darumaka
data.flavorText: It lived in snowy areas for so long that its fire sac cooled off and atrophied. It now has an organ that generates cold instead.

data.name: Marowak

attacks.name: Bonemerang
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Call for Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fighting Basic Pokémon card and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.)

data.flavorText: The bone it holds is its key weapon. It throws the bone skillfully like a boomerang to K.O. targets.

data.name: Sigilyph

attacks.name: Reflect
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 40 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Telekinesis
attacks.text: Does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.flavorText: The guardians of an ancient city, they use their psychic power to attack enemies that invade their territory.

data.name: Huntail

attacks.name: Scary Face
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack or retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Threaten and Drop
attacks.text: If Huntail has any Darkness Energy attached to it, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage and discard a Special Energy card, if any, attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It lives deep in the sea. With a tail shaped like a small fish, it attracts unsuspecting prey.

data.name: Greninja

attacks.name: Shadow Stitching
attacks.text: Until the end of your opponent's next turn, each Pokémon your opponent has in play, in his or her hand, and in his or her discard pile has no Abilities. (This includes cards that come into play on that turn.)

attacks.name: Moonlight Slash
attacks.text: You may return a Water Energy from this Pokémon to your hand. If you do, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: It appears and vanishes with a ninja's grace. It toys with its enemies using swift movements, while slicing them with throwing stars of sharpest water.

attacks.name: Fast Evolution
attacks.text: Search your deck for an Evolution card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Electabuzz

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Thunder Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage. If tails, this Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It loves to feed on strong electricity. It occasionally appears around large power plants and so on.

data.name: Cherubi
data.flavorText: It evolves by sucking the energy out of the small ball where it had been storing nutrients.

data.name: Drifloon

attacks.name: Minimize
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Drifloon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Pull
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It is whispered that any child who mistakes Drifloon for a balloon and holds on to it could wind up missing.

data.name: Metang

attacks.name: Bullet Punch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: It is formed by two Beldum joining together. Its two brains are linked, amplifying its psychic power.

data.name: Electivire

attacks.name: Thunder Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 more damage. If tails, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Giga Impact
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

data.flavorText: It pushes the tips of its tails against its foes and then lets loose a high-voltage current. Its foes are burned to a crisp in an instant.

abilities.name: Submerge
abilities.text: As long as Feebas is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to Feebas by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Klink

attacks.name: Charge Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, attach an Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The two minigears that mesh together are predetermined. Each will rebound from other minigears without meshing.

data.name: Spheal

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: They can't swim well yet, and they move much faster by rolling. When they're happy, they clap fins.

data.name: Light Golduck

attacks.name: Flipper Stroke
attacks.text: Your opponent looks at the top 3 cards of his or her deck. If any of them are basic Energy cards, he or she may show any number of them to you and put them into his or her hand. You do the same. Either way, each player shuffles his or her deck.

attacks.name: Core Blast
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each Special Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The faster it swims, the brighter the glow on its forehead becomes.

attacks.name: Snatch and Run
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon Tool card or Rocket's Secret Machine card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. If you do, you may switch Rocket's Meowth with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Miraculous Comeback
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's). This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads. Rocket's Meowth does 10 damage times the number of tails to itself.

data.name: Tapu Koko-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Aero Trail
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may move any number of Lightning Energy from your other Pokémon to this Pokémon. If you do, switch this Pokémon with your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Tapu Thunder-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage times the amount of Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Dark Vaporeon

attacks.name: Whirlpool
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them and discard it.

data.flavorText: A Pokémon capable of controlling water, so it is capable of creating giant whirlpools.

data.name: Drowzee

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: Puts enemies to sleep, then eats their dreams. Occasionally gets sick from eating bad dreams.

data.name: Pelipper

attacks.name: Power Cyclone
attacks.text: Move an Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It is a messenger of the skies, carrying small Pokémon and eggs to safety in its bill.

data.name: Sawk

attacks.name: Kick of Righteousness
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Team Plasma Pokémon, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.flavorText: Desiring the strongest karate chop, they seclude themselves in mountains and train without sleeping.

data.name: Druddigon

abilities.name: Rough Skin
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 3 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It warms its body by absorbing sunlight with its wings. When its body temperature falls, it can no longer move.

data.name: Ivysaur

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from Ivysaur.

data.flavorText: When the bud on its back starts swelling, a sweet aroma wafts to indicate the flower's coming bloom.

attacks.name: Twin Play
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 in any combination of Scyther and Scyther ex and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Scyther during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Extra Ball
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Pokémon-ex, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

abilities.name: Strikes Back
abilities.text: If Machoke is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Machoke is Knocked Out), put 1 damage counter on the Attacking Pokémon.

data.name: Rayquaza C LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Rayquaza C. Rayquaza C LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Dragon Spirit
abilities.text: If Rayquaza C is your Active Pokémon and is damaged but not Knocked Out by an opponent's attack, you may search your discard pile for an Energy card and attach it to Rayquaza C.

attacks.name: Final Blowup
attacks.text: Discard all Energy attached to Rayquaza C. Ignore this effect if you have no cards in your hand.

data.name: Simipour

attacks.name: Green Fling
attacks.text: Put 3 Grass Energy from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Hand Fling
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage times the number of cards in your hand.

data.flavorText: It prefers places with clean water. When its tuft runs low, it replenishes it by siphoning up water with its tail.

data.name: Pikachu VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: G-Max Volt Tackle
attacks.text: You may discard all Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 150 more damage.

abilities.name: Levitate
abilities.text: If Vibrava has any basic Energy cards attached to it, Vibrava's Retreat Cost is 0.

data.name: Chandelure

abilities.name: Fainting Spell
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, flip a coin. If heads, the Attacking Pokémon is Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Cursed Drop
attacks.text: Put 6 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

data.flavorText: Being consumed in Chandelure's flame burns up the spirit, leaving the body behind.

data.name: Dewpider

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It crawls onto the land in search of food. Its water bubble allows it to breathe and protects its soft head.

data.name: Farfetch'd

attacks.name: Leek Jab
attacks.text: This attack can't be used during your next turn. (Benching Farfetch'd ends this effect.)

data.flavorText: If anyone tries to disturb where the essential plant sticks grow, it uses its own stick to thwart them.

data.name: Joltik

attacks.name: Leech Life
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: They attach themselves to large-bodied Pokémon and absorb static electricity, which they store in an electric pouch.

data.name: Kakuna

attacks.name: Stiffen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Kakuna during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: Almost incapable of moving, this Pokémon can only harden its shell to protect itself from predators.

data.name: Ekans
data.flavorText: The older it gets, the longer it grows. At night, it wraps its long body around tree branches to rest.

data.name: Eevee

abilities.name: Energy Evolution
abilities.text: When you attach a basic Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon during your turn, you may search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon that is the same type as that Energy card and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Quick Draw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, draw a card.

data.flavorText: Current studies show it can evolve into an incredible eight different species of Pokémon.

data.name: Chandelure

abilities.name: Sinister Selection
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at the top 2 cards of your deck and put 1 of them into your hand. Discard the other card.

attacks.name: Past Friends
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each Supporter card in your discard pile.

data.flavorText: The spirits burned up in its ominous flame lose their way and wander this world forever.

attacks.name: Split Bomb
attacks.text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Unown [!]

abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Unown ! from your hand onto your Bench, you may flip a coin. If heads, put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. If tails, put 2 damage counters on 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hidden Power
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage. If tails, Unown ! does 10 damage to itself, and this attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.flavorText: Shaped like an ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or Unown came first.

data.name: Reshiram-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Glinting Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Brave Fire
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 50 damage to itself.

data.name: Incineroar-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Hustling Strike
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each of your Benched Fire Pokémon.

attacks.name: Tiger Swing
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Burning Slam-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

attacks.name: Horn Pierce
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If either of them is tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Endure
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, if Seaking would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, Seaking is not Knocked Out and its remaining HP becomes 10 instead.

data.flavorText: In autumn, its body becomes more fatty in preparing to propose to a mate. It takes on beautiful colors.

data.name: Bede
rules: Attach a basic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

abilities.name: Floating Electrons
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Energy attached to it, it has no Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a Poké Ball, it has zapped many people.

data.name: Abomasnow

attacks.name: Quick Freeze
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has any Water Energy attached to it, it is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Wild Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It blankets wide areas in snow by whipping up blizzards. It is also known as "The Ice Monster."

attacks.name: Tail Shake
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 60 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: It lives in dense jungles. While closing in on its prey, it leaps from branch to branch.

attacks.name: Perplex
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: Each of them carries a mask that used to be its face when it was human. Sometimes they look at it and cry.

data.name: Grimer

attacks.name: Nasty Goo
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It was born when sludge in a dirty stream was exposed to the moon's X-rays. It appears among filth.

data.name: Misdreavus

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: It will use any means necessary to frighten people and absorb their life energy. It practices constantly to hone its skill in causing fear.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.text: If Kirlia and the Defending Pokémon have a different amount of Energy attached to them, this attack's base damage is 30 instead of 60.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Cosmic Cyclone
attacks.text: Choose as many Water Energy attached to your Pokémon as you like. This attack does 20 damage times the number of Energy you chose. Shuffle those cards back into your deck.

data.flavorText: The middle section of its body is called the core. It glows in a different color each time it is seen.

attacks.name: Sinister Fog
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Creep Show
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has 3 or more damage counters on it, that Pokémon is Knocked Out.

data.flavorText: Hiding in people's shadows at night, it absorbs their heat. The chill it causes makes the victims shake.

data.name: Eevee
data.flavorText: Current studies show it can evolve into an incredible eight different species of Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It uses different kinds of cries for communicating with others of its kind and for pursuing its prey.

attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the amount of Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.text: Attach a Water Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon. If you do, switch it with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.text: Put 2 Water Energy attached to this Pokémon into your hand.

attacks.name: Twister
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are tails, this attack does nothing. For each heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It renders its prey immobile using well-developed claws, then carries the prey more than 60 miles to its nest.

attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Bolt Strike
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 40 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon appears in legends. In its tail, it has a giant generator that creates electricity.

attacks.name: Endure
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, then if, during your opponent's next turn, Phanpy would be Knocked Out by an attack, Phanpy isn't Knocked Out and its remaining HP become 10 instead.

data.flavorText: It swings its long snout around playfully, but, because it is so strong, that can be dangerous.

data.flavorText: If its coat becomes fully charged with electricity, its tail lights up. It fires hair that zaps on impact.

attacks.name: Inviting Bell
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Supporter card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: It emits cries by agitating an orb at the back of its throat. It moves with flouncing hops.

abilities.name: Primal Aura
abilities.text: As long as Kabutops is your Active Pokémon, neither player can play Basic Pokémon or Evolution cards from his or her hand to evolve Benched Pokémon.

attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: It has enough psychic energy to blast everything within 300 feet of itself, but it has no control over its power.

data.flavorText: It knows where pure water wells up. It carries fellow Pokémon there on its back.

attacks.name: Cursed Drop
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

data.flavorText: A discarded bug shell that came to life. Peering into the crack on its back is said to steal one's spirit.

data.flavorText: It appears as if from nowhere—muttering incantations, placing curses, and giving people terrifying visions.

data.name: Uxie

attacks.name: Psychic Restore
attacks.text: You may put Uxie and all cards attached to it on the bottom of your deck in any order.

data.flavorText: Known as "The Being of Knowledge." It is said that it can wipe out the memory of those who see its eyes.

attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Because the long hair all over its body obscures its sight, it just keeps charging repeatedly.

data.flavorText: Almost invisible, this gaseous Pokémon cloaks the target and puts it to sleep without notice.

data.flavorText: The pumpkin body is inhabited by a spirit trapped in this world. As the sun sets, it becomes restless and active.

attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If 1 of them is tails, discard 2 Energy cards attached to Charizard. If both are tails, discard all Energy cards attached to Charizard.

abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Unown from your hand onto your Bench, remove all Special Conditions from your Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its flat, thin body is always stuck on walls. Its shape appears to have some meaning.

attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.flavorText: It is highly perceptive of its Trainer's feelings. It dances when it is feeling happy.

data.name: Wormadam Trash Cloak

attacks.name: Cloak Shard
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. If you have Wormadam Plant Cloak in play, this attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon instead. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Serve Trash
attacks.text: You may search your opponent's discard pile for any 1 card, show it to your opponent, and put it on top of his or her deck.

data.flavorText: When evolving, its body takes in surrounding materials. As a result, there are many body variations.

data.name: Drifloon

attacks.name: Sneaky Placement
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Because of the way it floats aimlessly, an old folktale calls it a "Signpost for Wandering Spirits."

data.name: Victreebel

attacks.name: Burning Scent
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned and Poisoned. Before applying these effects, you may switch 1 of the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. The new Defending Pokémon is now Burned and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Energy Dissolve
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon at the end of your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It pools in its mouth a fluid with a honeylike scent, which is really an acid that dissolves anything.

data.name: Metagross

ancientTrait.name: θ Double
ancientTrait.text: This Pokémon may have up to 2 Pokémon Tool cards attached to it.

attacks.name: Machine Gun Stomp
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each card in your hand.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: Metang combined to form it. With four brains, it has the intelligence of a supercomputer.

data.name: Chinchou

attacks.name: Spark
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It lives in the depths beyond the reach of sunlight. It flashes lights on its antennae to communicate with others of its kind.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Metal Ball
attacks.text: Put 5 damage counters on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Energy Stream
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a basic Energy card and attach it to Poliwhirl.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Growth
attacks.text: Attach a Grass Energy card from your hand to Bulbasaur.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Gigashock
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon (1 if there is only 1). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Machoke

attacks.name: Steady Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Brick Break
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Machoke's boundless power is very dangerous, so it wears a belt that suppresses its energy.

data.name: Gothita

attacks.name: Hypnotic Gaze
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Double Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: Their ribbonlike feelers increase their psychic power. They are always staring at something.

data.name: Sandile

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: It moves along below the sand's surface, except for its nose and eyes. A dark membrane shields its eyes from the sun.

data.name: Meowstic

attacks.name: Teleportation Burst
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The eyeball patterns on the interior of its ears emit psychic energy. It keeps the patterns tightly covered because that power is too immense.

data.name: Parasect

attacks.name: Spore
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: A host-parasite pair in which the parasite mushroom has taken over the host bug. Prefers damp places.

data.name: Light Machoke

attacks.name: Return Home
attacks.text: If you have any Benched Pokémon, shuffle 1 of them and all cards attached to it into your deck.

attacks.name: Gentle Kick
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has no damage counters on it, this attack does 40 damage. If it has any, this attack does 20 damage.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon never gets tired, no matter what it does or how hard it works.

data.name: Mewtwo

attacks.name: Psyslash
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: A Pokémon created by recombining Mew's genes. It's said to have the most savage heart among Pokémon.

data.name: Spoink
data.flavorText: It bounces constantly, using its tail like a spring. The shock of bouncing keeps its heart beating.

data.name: Luxray

abilities.name: Intimidating Fang
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks do 30 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Volt Bolt
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 150 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Luxray's ability to see through objects comes in handy when it's scouting for danger.

data.name: Kyurem

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Frost Spear
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It generates a powerful, freezing energy inside itself, but its body became frozen when the energy leaked out.

data.name: Tentacruel

attacks.name: Wicked Tentacles
attacks.text: Move an Energy from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon to another of their Pokémon. If you do, put 3 damage counters on the Pokémon you moved the Energy to.

attacks.name: Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It fires off ultrasonic waves from its red orbs to weaken its prey, and then it wraps them up in its 80 tentacles.

data.name: Mankey

attacks.name: Focus Energy
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Flop attack's base damage is 50.

data.flavorText: It lives in treetop colonies. If one becomes enraged, the whole colony rampages for no reason.

data.name: Cofagrigus

attacks.name: Damagriiigus
attacks.text: Move all damage counters from 1 of your Benched Pokémon to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Perplex
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: It has been said that they swallow those who get too close and turn them into mummies. They like to eat gold nuggets.

abilities.name: Immunity
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of your opponent's attacks done to Machamp.

attacks.name: Drag Off
attacks.text: Before doing damage, if your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and switch it with the Defending Pokémon. If your opponent has no Benched Pokémon, ignore this effect.

attacks.name: Hurricane Punch
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Quagsire

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Due to its relaxed and carefree attitude, it often bumps its head on boulders and boat hulls as it swims.

data.name: Zekrom

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Bolt Strike
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 40 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon appears in legends. In its tail, it has a giant generator that creates electricity.

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Geodude does 50 damage to itself.

data.name: Eevee

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Tickle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Its irregularly configured DNA is affected by its surroundings. It evolves if its environment changes.

data.name: Meowstic-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Shadow Ear
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Mind Shock
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.name: Dialga

attacks.name: Time Call
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from 1 of your Pokémon and put it onto that Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Time Wager
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If either of them is tails, this attack's base damage is 50 instead of 100.

data.flavorText: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.

data.name: Croconaw

abilities.name: Evolutionary Vitality
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Croconaw from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may look at the top 5 cards of your deck. Choose all Energy cards you find there, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Put the other cards back on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Hover Over
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: Once it bites down, it won't let go until it loses its fangs. New fangs quickly grow into place.

data.name: Heatran

attacks.name: Lava Burn
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Heat Bazooka
attacks.text: Discard the top 5 cards of your deck.

data.flavorText: Boiling blood, like magma, circulates through its body. It makes its dwelling place in volcanic caves.

attacks.name: Focus Energy
attacks.text: During your next turn, Lt. Surge's Raticate's Double-edge attack's damage (base damage and damage to itself) is doubled.

attacks.name: Double-edge
attacks.text: Lt. Surge's Raticate does 20 damage to itself.

data.name: Hippopotas

attacks.name: Yawn
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Sand Attack
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: It lives in arid places. Instead of perspiration, it expels grainy sand from its body.

data.name: Noibat

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: They live in pitch black caves. Their enormous ears can emit ultrasonic waves of 200,000 hertz.

data.name: Qwilfish

abilities.name: Poison Point
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Venoshock
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.flavorText: The small spikes covering its body developed from scales. They inject a toxin that causes fainting.

data.name: Gothita

attacks.name: Psy Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Their ribbonlike feelers increase their psychic power. They are always staring at something.

data.name: Jangmo-o

attacks.name: Iron Defense
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It expresses its feelings by smacking its scales. Metallic sounds echo through the tall mountains where Jangmo-o lives.

data.name: Walrein

attacks.name: Cold Snap
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Trainer cards from their hand during their next turn. If 1 of your Pokémon used Cold Snap during your last turn, this attack can't be used.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It shatters ice with its big tusks. Its thick blubber repels not only the cold, but also enemy attacks.

data.name: Eelektrik

attacks.name: Small Appetite
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon's maximum HP is 100 or more, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: It wraps itself around its prey and paralyzes it with electricity from the round spots on its sides. Then it chomps.

data.name: Sableye

attacks.name: Shadow Cage
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It hides in the darkness of caves. Its diet of gems has transformed its eyes into gemstones.

data.name: Goldeen

attacks.name: Fin Smack
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: Its dorsal, pectoral and tail fins wave elegantly in the water. That is why it is known as the water dancer.

data.name: Omanyte

abilities.name: Clairvoyance
abilities.text: Your opponent plays with his or her hand face up. This power stops working while Omanyte is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Omanyte but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

data.flavorText: Although long extinct, in rare cases, it can be genetically resurrected from fossils.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Flickering Tail
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Shining Mew

attacks.name: Legendary Guidance
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: Because it can use all kinds of moves, many scientists believe Mew to be the ancestor of Pokémon.

data.name: Electrode
data.flavorText: It is known to drift on winds if it is bloated to bursting with stored electricity.

data.name: Riolu

attacks.name: Tumble Over
attacks.text: Riolu can't attack during your next turn.

data.flavorText: They communicate with one another using their auras. They are able to run all through the night.

data.name: Gourgeist

abilities.name: Gourgantic
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Grass Energy attached to it, its maximum HP is 200.

attacks.name: Horror Note
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage times the number of cards in your hand.

data.flavorText: Singing in eerie voices, they wander town streets on the night of the new moon. Anyone who hears their song is cursed.

data.name: Electabuzz
data.flavorText: It loves to feed on strong electricity. It occasionally appears around large power plants and so on.

data.name: Growlithe
data.flavorText: Very protective of its territory. It will bark and bite to repel intruders from its space.

data.name: Hawlucha

attacks.name: Backflip
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Wicked Jab
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: With its wings, it controls its position in the air. It likes to attack from above, a maneuver that is difficult to defend against.

data.name: Eevee

attacks.name: Signs of Evolution
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from Eevee, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Wild Kick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: It has the ability to alter the composition of its body to suit its surrounding environment.

data.name: Tirtouga
data.flavorText: It was restored from an ancient fossil. Tirtouga lived in the sea but came up onto the land to search for prey.

data.name: Mew

abilities.name: Neutral Shield
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Mew by Evolved Pokémon. You can't use this power if Mew is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: So rare that it is still said to be a mirage by many experts. Only a few people have seen it worldwide.

data.name: Solrock

abilities.name: Sunshine Fate
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have Lunatone in play, you may look at the top 3 cards of your deck and put them back on top of your deck in any order. This power can't be used if Solrock is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Luna Turn
attacks.text: If Lunatone is in your discard pile, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage. Then, search your discard pile for Lunatone, show it to your opponent, and shuffle it into your deck.

data.flavorText: A new Pokémon species, rumored to be from the sun. It gives off light while spinning.

data.name: Tympole

attacks.name: Spiral Attack
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: Graceful ripples running across the water's surface are a sure sign that Tympole are singing in high-pitched voices below.

abilities.name: Submerge
abilities.text: As long as Whiscash is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to Whiscash by your opponent's attacks.

attacks.name: Magnitude
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Audino

attacks.name: Double Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: It touches others with the feelers on its ears, using the sound of their heartbeats to tell how they are feeling.

data.name: Horsea

attacks.name: Fin Smack
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: Its big, developed fins move rapidly, allowing it to swim backward while still facing forward.

abilities.name: Heavyweight
abilities.text: As long as there is a Grass Energy attached to Muk, you must pay an additional ColorlessColorless to retreat it.

attacks.name: Burning Sludge
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the amount of Grass Energy attached to Muk. If any of them are heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned and Burned.

data.name: Bill's Analysis
rules: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal up to 2 Trainer cards you find there and put them into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Slowbro

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Facade
attacks.text: If this Pokémon is Burned or Poisoned, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.flavorText: It spaces out while gazing at the sea. With Shellder's poison flowing through its body, it becomes even spacier.

abilities.name: Makeover
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a basic Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex). If you do, search your discard pile for a basic Energy card (excluding the one you discarded) and attach it to that Pokémon. This power can't be used if Smeargle is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Split Spiral Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Great Ball
rules: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal a Pokémon you find there and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Machoke

attacks.name: Karate Chop
attacks.text: Does 50 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on Machoke.

attacks.name: Submission
attacks.text: Machoke does 20 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Its muscular body is so powerful that it must wear a power-save belt to help regulate its motions.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Aqua Trick
attacks.text: Move 1 Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If your opponent has no Benched Pokémon, this effect does nothing.

data.name: Magikarp

attacks.name: Rapid Evolution
attacks.text: Search your deck for an Evolution card named Gyarados or Dark Gyarados and put it on Magikarp. (This counts as evolving Magikarp.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: Recent research has revealed the presence of dragon DNA in this species of Pokémon.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Kakuna

attacks.name: Secrete Poison
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, whenever your opponent's attack damages Kakuna (even if Kakuna is Knocked Out), your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned and Kakuna does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Although it is a cocoon, it can move a little. It can extend its poison barb if it is attacked.

data.name: Tapu Koko ◇
rules: ◇ (Prism Star) Rule: You can't have more than 1 ◇ card with the same name in your deck. If a ◇ card would go to the discard pile, put it in the Lost Zone instead.

abilities.name: Dance of the Ancients
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is on your Bench, you may choose 2 of your Benched Pokémon and attach a Lightning Energy card from your discard pile to each of them. If you do, discard all cards from this Pokémon and put it in the Lost Zone.

data.flavorText: It confuses its enemies by flying too quickly for the eye to follow. It has a hair-trigger temper but forgets what made it angry an instant later.

data.name: Kingdra

ancientTrait.name: α Growth
ancientTrait.text: When you attach an Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon (except with an attack, Ability, or Trainer card), you may attach 2 Energy cards.

attacks.name: Gather Strength
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 4 basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Dragon Blast
attacks.text: Discard a Water and a Lightning Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It stores energy by sleeping at underwater depths at which no other life-forms can survive.

data.name: Prinplup

attacks.name: Ice Blade
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Wash Over
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Its wings deliver wicked blows that snap even the thickest of trees. It searches for prey in icy seas.
